description.en:
Burn, Red Fang!!
The big edition of orthodox professional wrestling is here!
The mysterious masked wrestler Red Fang goes on a rampage like a madman when he hears the cries of a child!
What is his secret?
We will deliver a complete recording of the unpublished phantom book!

Synopsis
Suddenly, a masked wrestler named Red Fang appears in the Japanese professional wrestling world!
He is as strong as Giant Baba and Antonio Inoki. What is he looking for when he steps into the ring?

Commentary
"Red Fang'', which was serialized in the first issue of "Shonen Champion'' in 1969, is a professional wrestling work by Hiroshi Kaizuka. Hiroshi Kaizuka had a huge hit with "Kurikuri pitcher,'' and his later masterpiece "Father's soul'' was serialized in the first issue of ``Shonen Jump'' in 1968. He was the first manga artist).
The main character of this work is a masked wrestler who calls himself "Red Fang," and the story revolves around his relationship with his nemesis, Black Fang. It is an ambitious work that combines professional wrestling action with the element of mystery solving, and although the first volume of this work was published in Akita Shoten's Shonen Champion Comics, the second volume was never published.
To all the fans who have been curious about Red Fang's activities, we present the first [complete book version]!
